item.title: Right message, wrong messengers
item.description: MULTIPLE things can be true at once. The Iranian people are engaged in a legitimate popular struggle against an entrenched political elite that has failed to meet their material needs and has answered demands for freedom and dignity with unconscionable violence and repression. At the same time, the US has no political, legal or moral basis to intervene in Iran. The dire......

item.title: AI in job market
item.description: ARTIFICIAL intelligence has entered people’s daily lives in such a way that the moment of shaping the future from fantasy to reality has remained unknown to many. It is currently used in office software, industrial machinery, medical image analysis and job application selection. The tasks that used to take a lot of people’s time are now being done automatically. The result......

item.title: Polygamy: betrayal of women
item.description: RECENT headlines — wife’s approval no longer essential for second marriage — are not only media hype. They reflect the profoundly worrying path of a High Court ruling. item.title: Bangladesh’s governance challenges
item.description: GOVERNANCE in South Asia has been closely examined in recent decades because of the region’s complex mix of political, economic, social and security challenges. Despite advances in democratic expansion and economic growth, the region still faces governance issues that erode public trust, hinder inclusive development and heighten social vulnerabilities. Bangladesh......

item.title: Custodial death raises alarm for accountability
item.description: THE death of a Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader in the custody of joint forces in Chuadanga early January 13 is unacceptable. The joint forces in a raid on an area at Jibannagar detained the general secretary of the party’s Jibannagar municipal unit at about 11:00pm late January 12 on charges of keeping an illegal firearm. item.title: EC has issues to address to ensure fair election
